page.title: 17THE RIDING SCHOOL
page.content: The owner of the{Spanish Bit}is{Mr. {E.L.Roland.}He has been the owner for 6 years. His daughter Jill is his partner.He has 25 acres and has seven staff to cover that land.They have 42 horses, 24 of their own and 18 livery horses.They have an outdoor and indoor arenas. To ride a pony or horse on the Common you pay a licence fee. The Spanish Bit has Common rights - they are allowed to keep 5 cows and 2 horses on the Common. It is called The Spanish Bit because years ago it was a Western riding school and they used a Spanish Bit. The horses have regular health checks, a vet comes each year and gives them a fly and tetanus jab, and checks their teeth. To have a horse shod it costs Â£ 14. They are shod every six weeks.
